image.altText: The exterior of a large club with lettering over the entrance reading "Hellenic Club".

props.synopsis: Canberra's Hellenic Club loses its bid to refer part of its challenge to a $1.2 million fine, imposed after the death by suicide of a man who was in debt due to problem gambling using its poker machines, to the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Hellenic Club loses bid to refer $1.2m fine challenge to Supreme Court

image.altText: A Whole New Ballgame | David Pocock

props.synopsis: He became the ACT's first ever independent Senator three years ago, but David Pocock wants to keep 'doing politics differently'.

title.children: Pocock wants to force major parties to 'actually put Australians first'

image.altText: Brindabella Christian College sign.

props.synopsis: The troubled Brindabella Christian College will close one of its campuses from Friday next week, after it was put under voluntary administration last month.

title.children: Brindabella Christian College to close Charnwood campus after voluntary administration decision

image.altText: Rohan Goyne in a blue-gray polo shirt with the collar turned up, sitting down and holding papers

props.synopsis: GP bulk billing rates in the ACT have declined since the pandemic, and federal government figures have cast doubt on whether a national target to bulk bill nine out of ten GP visits will be met.

title.children: Rohan struggles to pay GP bills. He's hoping that will change

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: Independent Senator David Pocock accuses the Australian National University of misleading a Senate estimates committee over how much it paid to a consulting firm.

title.children: Pocock calls for inquiry into ANU leadership over $1 million contract

image.altText: ACT Chief Police Officer Scott Lee in the Belconnen Police Station

props.synopsis: ACT police say a trio of masked men orchestrated four targeted shootings in Canberra over a week, leaving one man with serious injuries and killing a pet dog.

title.children: One man injured and dog killed in spate of shootings across Canberra, police say

image.altText: A graphic of the commemorative $1 coin, titled Swift and Sure.

props.synopsis: The Mint has released a $1 coin for the centenary of the Royal Australian Corps of Signals, complete with a secret encoded message.

title.children: Can you solve the code on this new $1 coin?

image.altText: Demonstrators hold signs behind Jennifer Vasquez Sura as she speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: A US court orders the Trump administration to bring back a young father who was mistakenly deported to a notorious megaprison in El Salvador.

title.children: US judge orders return of father deported to megaprison 'in error'

image.altText: Jed Walter celebrates with his arms clenched above his head

props.synopsis: The umpires find themselves in hot water after a controversial non-call as the Suns beat the Crows, as Brisbane's Will Ashcroft submits a Goal of the Year contender at the MCG against Richmond. Follow live.

title.children: Claims umpires 'froze' in Suns-Crows thriller, Ashcroft drills miracle goal against Tigers

image.altText: Tino Fa’asuamaleaui of the Gold Coast Titans walks off the field during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Titans host a Queensland derby against the Dolphins after Zac Lomax gets the Eels their first win with a golden-point field goal against former club St George Illawarra. Follow live.

title.children: High-tackle crackdown continues as Titans and Dolphins sin-binned

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HALF-TIME: Dolphins lead the Titans 16-0, hunting their first win
37' Tino Fa'asuamaleaui costs his team two points
Daniel Saifiti crashes over for the Dolphins!

image.altText: Close up on a bee sitting in a flower on an almond tree

props.synopsis: Some Australian farmers are expecting to reap the benefits of Trump's trade war as international markets look to source products from other regions.

title.children: Fruit, nut growers' profits could bloom as Trump's tariffs anger global markets

image.altText: trump tiktok

props.synopsis: Sources say a deal to spin off the US assets of TikTok has been put on hold, with China indicating it will not approve the deal following US President Donald Trump's tariffs announcement.

title.children: Trump's tariffs put US-China TikTok deal in doubt

image.altText: Donald Trump shakes hands with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi formed a bromance but can their MEGA partnership continue with the US president's new tariffs regime coming in?

title.children: Tariffs are testing the limits of a great 'bromance' with Trump

image.altText: Mokbel - family

props.synopsis: After 18 years behind bars, the underworld drug trafficker begins his first full day of freedom with a morning stroll, a police check-in and a jaunt to the shops.

title.children: Crime figure Tony Mokbel marks first day of freedom with morning walk

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: My son is the same age as the teenager in Adolescence. Watching it together made me realise the reality of the school kids in the show is the shared reality of our own child.

title.children: Watching Adolescence with my teen son left me with terrifying questions

image.altText: A truck drives out of the entrance of the Darwin Port on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Darwin port’s lease to a Chinese-owned company has outlasted successive prime ministers. So why are the major parties talking about cancelling it now?

title.children: Darwin's port has been controversial for years. So why the action now?

image.altText: US President Trump holds up a board showing the reciprocal tariffs on other countries at the White House rose garden.

props.synopsis: We've all talked about the potential strategic and economic ramifications for Australia of Trump's America First policies. Well, they are now happening. And the whole world will never be the same.

title.children: We've talked about potential Trump consequences. Now they're happening

image.altText: A map showing an earthquake epicentre and concentric circles off the coast of Papua New Guinea.

props.synopsis: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake has struck off Papua New Guinea's coast on Saturday morning.

title.children: 6.9-magnitude quake hits off Papua New Guinea coast

image.altText: A woman with short black hair stands near a golden tower-like pagoda.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's diaspora in Australia is left reeling from the earthquake that has now killed more than 3,000 people.

title.children: 'My teacher, my hero, is gone': Australia's Myanmar community mourns losses

image.altText: A phone app for Australian Super

props.synopsis: Many Australians were anxiously checking their super accounts on Friday, after news broke of suspected cyber attacks on multiple large superannuation funds.

title.children: 'I can't start at zero now': Australians want answers after cyber attack on super

image.altText: AI security scanning machine outside MCG entrance

props.synopsis: Since a major security breach at Australia's biggest sports ground, questions are being asked about the security screening technology being used — the first of its type in Australia.

title.children: AI security experts argue MCG gun breach wasn't just 'human error'

image.altText: Small dead fishes at the shore of the beach at Loch Sport

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating why thousands of dead fish washed up on the shore of the regional Victorian town of Loch Sport. But locals are worried they will be left without an answer again.

title.children: Loch Sport locals worried by another mass fish death on pristine beach

image.altText: Tim Tszyu leans on the ring ropes

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu's bold, brash bravery in the ring has been his hallmark. But now, any room for error has passed by, with a dangerous American opponent threatening to continue the Australian fighter's slide from confidence to hubris.

title.children: Tszyu needs to harness his overconfidence to regain aura

image.altText: Four astronauts in spacesuits link arms and smile for the camera

props.synopsis: After orbiting the north and south poles in a privately funded flight, four space tourists have safely splashed down in the Pacific Ocean.

title.children: SpaceX crew with Australian polar explorer returns to Earth

image.altText: Mid shot of a man standing near a helicopter in foreground, surrounded by floodwater at sunset

props.synopsis: Helicopter pilots saved the lives of Queenslanders as floodwater tore through their towns. Now they are providing life-saving supplies to isolated communities and their livestock.

title.children: Chopper pilots make flooded outback Queenslanders 'ridiculously proud'

image.altText: Dave sits on a dining table seat wearing a blue shirt and hat and looks directly into the camera with his mouth slightly open.

props.synopsis: More than 20 people have been left with unfinished dental implants, including a man who learnt in an ABC article that both his dentists had been suspended after he paid $55,500 for a major procedure.

title.children: More patients thousands out of pocket after dentists suspended

image.altText: The outside of a white suburban two storey home where upstairs windows are burnt out

props.synopsis: The man, now known only as "Male Victim 1", alleges he was held prisoner by his stepmother for 20 years — weighing just 31kg when rescued.

title.children: A house fire led US police to a man allegedly held captive for decades

image.altText: Tony Mokbel smiles while surrounded by police and media

props.synopsis: Tony Mokbel believes he's spent enough time behind bars, and his release on bail is a sign some of Victoria's most senior legal minds agree.

title.children: More legal highs could be on the way for drug trafficker Tony Mokbel

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a white shirt

props.synopsis: Annouchka de Jong Heybroek has been immersed in an ugly four-year dispute with her neighbours, strata manager and the apartment block's developer over who is responsible for water gushing through her faulty balcony.

title.children: Rotting floors, a private eye and a 'zany' strata battle

image.altText: A man in a green fire suit and white hard hat inspects a burnt tree in a scorched landscape.

props.synopsis: For the first time this Victorian bushfire season, a specialist Indigenous team protected sacred sites from the Grampians and Little Desert blazes, preventing important art and history from turning to ash.

title.children: Less bulldozing, more hand labour: A blueprint for firefighting strategy

image.altText: A traffic jam in inner Brisbane

props.synopsis: The prime minister insists his government's vehicle efficiency standards scheme has "strong support" from industry, as car makers consider pulling models from Australia.

title.children: Albanese backs in vehicle emissions standard despite car makers' concerns

image.altText: ukraine fire

props.synopsis: A Russian missile strike in President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's home town has killed at least 16 people and wounded more than 50, Ukraine says.

title.children: Russian strike kills 16 in Zelenskyy's home town, Ukraine says

image.altText: A woman wearing a green medical shirt named Tamara Hunter.

props.synopsis: Many women who suffer from uterine fibroids are asymptomatic, but others experience intense pelvic pain and heavy periods — and doctors still don't know what causes the condition.

title.children: Anne fell pregnant six times, but never gave birth. Later in life she found out why

image.altText: Russell Brand

props.synopsis: British police charge actor and comedian Russell Brand with rape and multiple sex offences after a bombshell 2023 media investigation made numerous claims about the celebrity.

title.children: Russell Brand charged with rape and sexual assault

image.altText: Michael Fassbender wearing a suit and glasses stares at Cate Blanchett, who smiles wearing a brown dress.

props.synopsis: Black Bag is the latest in a string of spy dramas to grace our big and small screens. But could our obsession with espionage reflect a deeper anxiety?

title.children: 'I struggle to watch': Ex-intelligence worker reflects on rise of TV spies
